answers.answer: Get yourself tested for the appropriate antibodies: HBsAb. If you have them, you are immune. That's it! If you have not developed immunity (happens with a few people), you must redo the 4 doses, and get tested again.
thank u for that info,i had my shots when i was 16 n then at 25 i had antibody test n there was no antibodies so i had them done again.
Sharp7 gives good advice. I did the vaccine in 2003 and then when they found out I have Hep C this past Jan. they checked for Hep B antibodies and I don't have any, so it didn't work for me.

no it is not like it didn't work for you, i have known several nurses vaccinated for hbv but when they got hcv the antibodies desapered.probably immune system needs all potency and cuts hbv antibodies who are not usefull

question: hi all just want to know if i have had my hep b shots (vaccination) then if i was to kiss or have sex with some1 with hep b is there any chance at all tht the vacc will have worn off or tht it doesnt work for every 1.lol i know it sounds like im over reacting but iv had worst luck in my life when it comes to catching things.iv already got a damaged liver cos i had hep c for 15 yrs n just got cured 8 months ago so i dont want to catch it back if ya know wht i mean n im a single mum n her dad didnt get cured n still has hep c n he is very very ill n has diabetes too so im bein selfish now for my daughter so i am bein very careful who i end up with cos im dating again as im single n i really dont want to risk gettin it again.cheersn toi all u heppers out there i hope u r all cured n well 1 day ur self too.btw is there treatment/cures for hep b yet....like hep c?
title: is the vaccination 100% protection against catching hep b
